meanings.definition: To write or mark down in a system of notation.
meanings.sent1: I will notate the important points in my notebook.
meanings.sent2: She likes to notate her thoughts in a journal every night.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked us to notate the key facts in our own words.
meanings.sent4: His memory was like a well-notated book, easy to refer back to.
meanings.sent5: Notating the instructions in bold made them stand out.

meanings.sent1: The composer will notate the melody for the orchestra.
meanings.sent2: Musicians often notate their compositions for others to play.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to notate its own tune on the piano keys.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter notated a joyful symphony in the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: Notating the rhythm accurately is crucial for the band's performance.
